<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dwarves and other odd folk that were quartered at Bag End. Excitement rose<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to its height.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then the weather clouded over. That was on Wednesday the eve of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Party. Anxiety was intense. Then Thursday, September the 22nd, actually<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dawned. The sun got up, the clouds vanished, flags were unfurled and the fun<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">began.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo Baggins called it a party, but it was really a variety of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">entertainments rolled into one. Practically everybody living near was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">invited. A very few were overlooked by accident, but as they turned up all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the same, that did not matter. Many people from other parts of the Shire<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were also asked; and there were even a few from outside the borders. Bilbo<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">met the guests (and additions) at the new white gate in person. Ele gave away<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">presents to all and sundry - the latter were those who went out again by a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">back way and came in again by the gate. Hobbits give presents to other<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">people on their own birthdays. Not very expensive ones, as a rule, and not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">so lavishly as on this occasion; but it was not a bad system. Actually in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Hobbiton and Bywater every day in the year it was somebodyâ€™s birthday, so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that every hobbit in those parts had a fair chance of at least one present<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">at least once a week. But they never got tired of them.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">On this occasion the presents were unusually good. The hobbit-children<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were so excited that for a while they almost forgot about eating. There were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">toys the like of which they had never seen before, all beautiful and some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">obviously magical. Many of them had indeed been ordered a year before, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had come all the way from the Mountain and from Dale, and were of real<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dwarf-make.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">When every guest had been welcomed and was finally inside the gate,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there were songs, dances, music, games, and, of course, food and drink.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There were three official meals: lunch, tea, and dinner (or supper). But<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lunch and tea were marked chiefly by the fact that at those times all the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">guests were sitting down and eating together. At other times there were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">merely lots of people eating and drinking - continuously from elevenses<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">until six-thirty, when the fireworks started.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The fireworks were by Gandalf: they were not only brought by him, but<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">designed and made by him; and the special effects, set pieces, and flights<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of rockets were let off by him. But there was also a generous distribution<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of squibs, crackers, backarappers, sparklers, torches, dwarf-candles,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">elf-fountains, goblin -barkers and thunder -claps. They were all superb. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">art of Gandalf improved with age.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There were rockets like a flight of scintillating birds singing with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sweet voices. There were green trees with trunks of dark smoke: their leaves<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">opened like a whole spring unfolding in a moment, and their shining branches<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dropped glowing flowers down upon the astonished hobbits, disappearing with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a sweet scent just before they touched their upturned faces. There were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fountains of butterflies that flew glittering into the trees; there were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pillars of coloured fires that rose and turned into eagles, or sailing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ships, or a phalanx of flying swans; there was a red thunderstorm and a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shower of yellow rain; there was a forest of silver spears that sprang<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">suddenly into the air with a yell like an embattled army, and came down<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">again into the Water with a hiss like a hundred hot snakes. And there was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">also one last surprise, in honour of Bilbo, and it startled the hobbits<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">exceedingly, as Gandalf intended. The lights went out. A great smoke went<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">up. It shaped itself like a mountain seen in the distance, and began to glow<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">at the summit. It spouted green and scarlet flames. Out flew a red -golden<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dragon - not life-size, but terribly life-like: fire came from his jaws, his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">eyes glared down; there was a roar, and he whizzed three times over the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">heads of the crowd. They all ducked, and many fell flat on their faces. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dragon passed like an express train, turned a somersault, and burst over<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bywater with a deafening explosion.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">That is the signal for supper!' said Bilbo. The pain and alarm<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">vanished at once, and the prostrate hobbits leaped to their feet. There was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a splendid supper for everyone; for everyone, that is, except those invited<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the special family dinner-party. This was held in the great pavilion with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the tree. The invitations were limited to twelve dozen (a number also called<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">by the hobbits one Gross, though the word was not considered proper to use<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of people); and the guests were selected from all the families to which<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo and Frodo were related, with the addition of a few special unrelated<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">friends (such as Gandalf). Many young hobbits were included, and present by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">parental permission; for hobbits were easy-going with their children in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">matter of sitting up late, especially when there was a chance of getting<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">them a free meal. Bringing up young hobbits took a lot of provender.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There were many Bagginses and Boffins, and also many Tooks and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Brandybucks; there were various Grubbs (relations of Bilbo Baggins'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">grandmother), and various Chubbs (connexions of his Took grandfather); and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">selection of Burrowses, Bolgers, Bracegirdles, Brockhouses, Goodbodies,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Hornblowers and Proudfoots. Some of these were only very distantly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">connected<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with Bilbo, and some of them had hardly ever been in Hobbiton before, as<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they lived in remote corners of the Shire. The Sackville-Bagginses were not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">forgotten. Otho and his wife Lobelia were present. They disliked Bilbo and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">detested Frodo, but so magnificent was the invitation card, written in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">golden ink, that they had felt it was impossible to refuse. Besides, their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cousin, Bilbo, had been specializing in food for many years and his table<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had a high reputation.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">All the one hundred and forty-four guests expected a pleasant feast;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">though they rather dreaded the after-dinner speech of their host (an<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">inevitable item). Fie was liable to drag in bits of what he called poetry;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and sometimes, after a glass or two, would allude to the absurd adventures<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of his mysterious journey. The guests were not disappointed: they had a very<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pleasant feast, in fact an engrossing entertainment: rich, abundant, varied,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and prolonged. The purchase of provisions fell almost to nothing throughout<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the district in the ensuing weeks; but as Bilbo's catering had depleted the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stocks of most stores, cellars and warehouses for miles around, that did not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">matter much.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">After the feast (more or less) came the Speech. Most of the company<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were, however, now in a tolerant mood, at that delightful stage which they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">called â€™filling up the cornersâ€™. They were sipping their favourite drinks,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and nibbling at their favourite dainties, and their fears were forgotten.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They were prepared to listen to anything, and to cheer at every full stop.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">My dear People, began Bilbo, rising in his place. â€™Flear! Flear! Hear!â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they shouted, and kept on repeating it in chorus, seeming reluctant to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">follow their own advice. Bilbo left his place and went and stood on a chair<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">under the illuminated tree. The light of the lanterns fell on his beaming<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">face; the golden buttons shone on his embroidered silk waistcoat. They could<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">all see him standing, waving one hand in the air, the other was in his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">trouser -pocket.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">My dear Bagginses and Boffins, he began again; and my dear Tooks and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Brandybucks, and Grubbs, and Chubbs, and Burrowses, and Hornblowers,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bolgers, Bracegirdles, Goodbodies, Brockhouses and Proudfoots.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'ProudFEET!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shouted an elderly hobbit from the back of the pavilion. His name, of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">course, was Proudfoot, and well merited; his feet were large, exceptionally<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">furry, and both were on the table.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Proudfoots, repeated Bilbo. Also my good Sackville-Bagginses that I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">welcome back at last to Bag End. Today is my one hundred and eleventh<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">birthday: I am eleventy -one today!' Hurray! Hurray! Many Happy Returns!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they shouted, and they hammered joyously on the tables. Bilbo was doing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">splendidly. This was the sort of stuff they liked: short and obvious.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I hope you are all enjoying yourselves as much as I am. Deafening<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cheers. Cries of Yes (and No). Noises of trumpets and horns, pipes and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flutes, and other musical instruments. There were, as has been said, many<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">young hobbits present. Hundreds of musical crackers had been pulled. Most of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">them bore the mark DALE on them; which did not convey much to most of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits, but they all agreed they were marvellous crackers. They contained<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">instruments, small, but of perfect make and enchanting tones. Indeed, in one<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">corner some of the young Tooks and Brandybucks, supposing Uncle Bilbo to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have finished (since he had plainly said all that was necessary), now got up<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">an impromptu orchestra, and began a merry dance-tune. Master Everard Took<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and Miss Melilot Brandybuck got on a table and with bells in their hands<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">began to dance the Springle-ring: a pretty dance, but rather vigorous.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">But Bilbo had not finished. Seizing a horn from a youngster near by, he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">blew three loud hoots. The noise subsided. / shall not keep you long, he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cried. Cheers from all the assembly. / have called you all together for a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Purpose. Something in the way that he said this made an impression. There<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was almost silence, and one or two of the Tooks pricked up their ears.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Indeed, for Three Purposes! First of all, to tell you that I am<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">immensely fond of you all, and that eleventy-one years is too short a time<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to live among such excellent and admirable hobbits. Tremendous outburst of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">approval.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">/ don 't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">than half of you half as well as you deserve. This was unexpected and rather<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">difficult. There was some scattered clapping, but most of them were trying<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to work it out and see if it came to a compliment.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Secondly, to celebrate my birthday. Cheers again. I should say: OUR<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">birthday. For it is, of course, also the birthday of my heir and nephew,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo. He comes of age and into his inheritance today. Some perfunctory<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clapping by the elders; and some loud shouts of â€™Frodo! Frodo! Jolly old<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo,' from the juniors. The Sackville-Bagginses scowled, and wondered what<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was meant by 'coming into his inheritance'. Together we score one hundred<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and forty-four. Your numbers were chosen to fit this remarkable total: One<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gross, if I may use the expression. No cheers. This was ridiculous. Many of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his guests, and especially the Sackville-Bagginses, were insulted, feeling<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sure they had only been asked to fill up the required number, like goods in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a package. 'One Gross, indeed! Vulgar expression.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It is also, if I may be allowed to refer to ancient history, the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">anniversary of my arrival by barrel at Esgaroth on the Long Lake; though the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fact that it was my birthday slipped my memory on that occasion. I was only<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fifty-one then, and birthdays did not seem so important. The banquet was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">very splendid, however, though I had a bad cold at the time, I remember, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">could only say 'thagyou very buch'. I now repeat it more correctly: Thank<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you very much for coming to my little party. Obstinate silence. They all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">feared that a song or some poetry was now imminent; and they were getting<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">bored. Why couldn't he stop talking and let them drink his health? But Bilbo<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">did not sing or recite. Fie paused for a moment.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Thirdly and finally, he said, I wish to make an ANNOUNCEMENT. Fie<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spoke<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">this last word so loudly and suddenly that everyone sat up who still could.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I regret to announce that - though, as I said, eleventy-one years is far too<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">short a time to spend among you - this is the END. I am going. I am leaving<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">NOW. GOOD-BYE 7<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He stepped down and vanished. There was a blinding flash of light, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the guests all blinked. When they opened their eyes Bilbo was nowhere to be<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seen. One hundred and forty-four flabbergasted hobbits sat back speechless.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Old Odo Proudfoot removed his feet from the table and stamped. Then there<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was a dead silence, until suddenly, after several deep breaths, every<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Baggins, Boffin, Took, Brandybuck, Grubb, Chubb, Burrows, Bolger,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bracegirdle, Brockhouse, Goodbody, Hornblower, and Proudfoot began to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">talk<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">at once.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was generally agreed that the joke was in very bad taste, and more<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">food and drink were needed to cure the guests of shock and annoyance. 'He's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mad. I always said so,' was probably the most popular comment. Even the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Tooks (with a few exceptions) thought Bilboâ€™s behaviour was absurd. For the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">moment most of them took it for granted that his disappearance was nothing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more than a ridiculous prank.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">But old Rory Brandybuck was not so sure. Neither age nor an enormous<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dinner had clouded his wits, and he said to his daughter-in-law, Esmeralda:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There's something fishy in this, my dear! I believe that mad Baggins is off<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">again. Silly old fool. But why worry? He hasn't taken the vittles with him.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He called loudly to Frodo to send the wine round again.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo was the only one present who had said nothing. For some time he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had sat silent beside Bilbo's empty chair, and ignored all remarks and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">questions. He had enjoyed the joke, of course, even though he had been in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the know. He had difficulty in keeping from laughter at the indignant<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">surprise of the guests. But at the same time he felt deeply troubled: he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">realized suddenly that he loved the old hobbit dearly. Most of the guests<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">went on eating and drinking and discussing Bilbo Baggins' oddities, past and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">present; but the Sackville-Bagginses had already departed in wrath. Frodo<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">did not want to have any more to do with the party. He gave orders for more<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wine to be served; then he got up and drained his own glass silently to the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">health of Bilbo, and slipped out of the pavilion.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">As for Bilbo Baggins, even while he was making his speech, he had been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fingering the golden ring in his pocket: his magic ring that he had kept<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">secret for so many years. As he stepped down he slipped it on his finger,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and he was never seen by any hobbit in Hobbiton again.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He walked briskly back to his hole, and stood for a moment listening<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with a smile to the din in the pavilion and to the sounds of merrymaking in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">other parts of the field. Then he went in. He took off his party clothes,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">folded up and wrapped in tissue-paper his embroidered silk waistcoat, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">put it away. Then he put on quickly some old untidy garments, and fastened<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">round his waist a worn leather belt. On it he hung a short sword in a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">battered black-leather scabbard. From a locked drawer, smelling of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">moth-balls, he took out an old cloak and hood. They had been locked up as if<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they were very precious, but they were so patched and weatherstained that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">their original colour could hardly be guessed: it might have been dark<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">green. They were rather too large for him. He then went into his study, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from a large strong-box took out a bundle wrapped in old cloths, and a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">leather -bound manuscript; and also a large bulky envelope. The book and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">bundle he stuffed into the top of a heavy bag that was standing there,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">already nearly full. Into the envelope he slipped his golden ring, and its<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fine chain, and then sealed it, and addressed it to Frodo. At first he put<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it on the mantelpiece, but suddenly he removed it and stuck it in his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pocket. At that moment the door opened and Gandalf came quickly in.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Hullo!' said Bilbo. 'I wondered if you would turn up.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I am glad to find you visible,' replied the wizard, sitting down in a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">chair, 'I wanted to catch you and have a few final words. I suppose you feel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that everything has gone off splendidly and according to plan?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, I do,' said Bilbo. "Though that flash was surprising: it quite<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">startled me, let alone the others. A little addition of your own, I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">suppose?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was. You have wisely kept that ring secret all these years, and it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seemed to me necessary to give your guests something else that would seem to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">explain your sudden vanishment.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And would spoil my joke. You are an interfering old busybody,' laughed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo, 'but I expect you know best, as usual.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I do - when I know anything. But I don't feel too sure about this<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">whole affair. It has now come to the final point. You have had your joke,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and alarmed or offended most of your relations, and given the whole Shire<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">something to talk about for nine days, or ninety-nine more likely. Are you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">going any further?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, I am. I feel I need a holiday, a very long holiday, as I have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">told you before. Probably a permanent holiday: I don't expect I shall<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">return. In fact, I don't mean to, and I have made all arrangements.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I am old, Gandalf. I don't look it, but I am beginning to feel it in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">my heart of hearts. Well-preserved indeed!' he snorted. 'Why, I feel all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thin, sort of stretched, if you know what I mean: like butter that has been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">scraped over too much bread. That can't be right. I need a change, or<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">something.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf looked curiously and closely at him. 'No, it does not seem<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">right,' he said thoughtfully. 'No, after all I believe your plan is probably<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the best.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, I've made up my mind, anyway. I want to see mountains again,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf, mountains, and then find somewhere where I can rest. In peace and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">quiet, without a lot of relatives prying around, and a string of confounded<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">visitors hanging on the bell. I might find somewhere where I can finish my<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">book. I have thought of a nice ending for it: and he lived happily ever<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">after to the end of his days. '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf laughed. I hope he will. But nobody will read the book, however<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it ends.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Oh, they may, in years to come. Frodo has read some already, as far as<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it has gone. You'll keep an eye on Frodo, won't you?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, I will - two eyes, as often as I can spare them.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'He would come with me, of course, if I asked him. In fact he offered<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to once, just before the party. But he does not really want to, yet. I want<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to see the wild country again before I die, and the Mountains; but he is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">still in love with the Shire, with woods and fields and little rivers. He<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ought to be comfortable here. I am leaving everything to him, of course,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">except a few oddments. I hope he will be happy, when he gets used to being<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on his own. It's time he was his own master now.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Everything?' said Gandalf. 'The ring as well? You agreed to that, you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">remember.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, er, yes, I suppose so,' stammered Bilbo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Where is it?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'In an envelope, if you must know,' said Bilbo impatiently. 'There on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the mantelpiece. Well, no! Here it is in my pocket!' He hesitated. 'Isn't<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that odd now?' he said softly to himself. 'Yet after all, why not? Why<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shouldn't it stay there?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf looked again very hard at Bilbo, and there was a gleam in his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">eyes. 'I think, Bilbo,' he said quietly, 'I should leave it behind. Don't<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you want to?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well yes - and no. Now it comes to it, I don't like parting with it at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">all, I may say. And I don't really see why I should. Why do you want me to?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he asked, and a curious change came over his voice. It was sharp with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">suspicion and annoyance. 'You are always badgering me about my ring; but<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have never bothered me about the other things that I got on my journey.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'No, but I had to badger you,' said Gandalf. 'I wanted the truth. It<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was important. Magic rings are - well, magical; and they are rare and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">curious. I was professionally interested in your ring, you may say; and I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">still am. I should like to know where it is, if you go wandering again. Also<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I think you have had it quite long enough. You won't need it any more.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo, unless I am quite mistaken.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo flushed, and there was an angry light in his eyes. His kindly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">face grew hard. 'Why not?' he cried. 'And what business is it of yours,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">anyway, to know what I do with my own things? It is my own. I found it. It<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">came to me.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, yes,' said Gandalf. 'But there is no need to get angry.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'If I am it is your fault,' said Bilbo. 'It is mine, I tell you. My<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">own. My precious. Yes, my precious.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The wizard's face remained grave and attentive, and only a flicker in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his deep eyes showed that he was startled and indeed alarmed. 'It has been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">called that before,' he said, 'but not by you.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But I say it now. And why not? Even if Gollum said the same once. It's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not his now, but mine. And I shall keep it, I say.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf stood up. He spoke sternly. 'You will be a fool if you do.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo,' he said. 'You make that clearer with every word you say. It has got<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">far too much hold on you. Let it go! And then you can go yourself, and be<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">free.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I'll do as I choose and go as I please,' said Bilbo obstinately.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Now, now, my dear hobbit! ' said Gandalf. 'All your long life we have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">been friends, and you owe me something. Come! Do as you promised: give it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">up! '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, if you want my ring yourself, say so!' cried Bilbo. 'But you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">won't get it. I won't give my precious away, I tell you.' His hand strayed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the hilt of his small sword.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf s eyes flashed. It will be my turn to get angry soon,' he said.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">If you say that again, I shall. Then you will see Gandalf the Grey<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">uncloaked.' He took a step towards the hobbit, and he seemed to grow tall<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and menacing; his shadow filled the little room.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo backed away to the wall, breathing hard, his hand clutching at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his pocket. They stood for a while facing one another, and the air of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">room tingled. Gandalf s eyes remained bent on the hobbit. Slowly his hands<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">relaxed, and he began to tremble.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I donâ€™t know what has come over you, Gandalf,' he said. 'You have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">never been like this before. What is it all about? It is mine isn't it? I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">found it, and Gollum would have killed me, if I hadn't kept it. I'm not a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thief, whatever he said.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I have never called you one,' Gandalf answered. 'And I am not one<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">either. I am not trying to rob you, but to help you. I wish you would trust<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">me, as you used.' He turned away, and the shadow passed. He seemed to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dwindle again to an old grey man, bent and troubled.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo drew his hand over his eyes. I am sorry,' he said. 'But I felt so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">queer. And yet it would be a relief in a way not to be bothered with it any<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more. It has been so growing on my mind lately. Sometimes I have felt it was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">like an eye looking at me. And I am always wanting to put it on and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">disappear, don't you know; or wondering if it is safe, and pulling it out to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">make sure. I tried locking it up, but I found I couldn't rest without it in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">my pocket. I don't know why. And I don't seem able to make up my mind.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Then trust mine,' said Gandalf. 'It is quite made up. Go away and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">leave it behind. Stop possessing it. Give it to Frodo, and I will look after<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">him.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo stood for a moment tense and undecided. Presently he sighed. 'All<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">right,' he said with an effort. I will.' Then he shrugged his shoulders, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">smiled rather ruefully. 'After all that's what this party business was all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">about, really: to give away lots of birthday presents, and somehow make it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">easier to give it away at the same time. It hasn't made it any easier in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">end, but it would be a pity to waste all my preparations. It would quite<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spoil the joke.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Indeed it would take away the only point I ever saw in the affair,'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said Gandalf.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Very well,' said Bilbo, 'it goes to Frodo with all the rest.' He drew<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a deep breath. 'And now I really must be starting, or somebody else will<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">catch me. I have said good-bye, and I couldn't bear to do it all over<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">again.' He picked up his bag and moved to the door.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You have still got the ring in your pocket,' said the wizard. 'Well,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">so I have!' cried Bilbo. 'And my will and all the other documents too. You<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had better take it and deliver it for me. That will be safest.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'No, donâ€™t give the ring to me,' said Gandalf. 'Put it on the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mantelpiece. It will be safe enough there, till Frodo comes. I shall wait<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for him.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo took out the envelope, but just as he was about to set it by the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clock, his hand jerked back, and the packet fell on the floor. Before he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">could pick it up, the wizard stooped and seized it and set it in its place.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A spasm of anger passed swiftly over the hobbit's face again. Suddenly it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gave way to a look of relief and a laugh. 'Well, that's that,' he said. 'Now<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I'm off!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They went out into the hall. Bilbo chose his favourite stick from the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stand; then he whistled. Three dwarves came out of different rooms where<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they had been busy.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Is everything ready?' asked Bilbo. 'Everything packed and labelled?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Everything,' they answered.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, let's start then!' He stepped out of the front-door.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was a fine night, and the black sky was dotted with stars. He looked<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">up, sniffing the air. 'What fun! What fun to be off again, off on the Road<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with dwarves ! This is what I have really been longing for, for years !<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Good-bye! ' he said, looking at his old home and bowing to the door.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Good-bye, Gandalf!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Good-bye, for the present, Bilbo. Take care of yourself! You are old<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">enough, and perhaps wise enough.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Take care! I don't care. Don't you worry about me! I am as happy now<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as I have ever been, and that is saying a great deal. But the time has come.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I am being swept off my feet at last,' he added, and then in a low voice, as<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">if to himself, he sang softly in the dark:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Road goes ever on and on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Down from the door where it began.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Now far ahead the Road has gone,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And I must follow, if I can,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pursuing it with eager feet,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Until it joins some larger way<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Where many paths and errands meet.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And whither then? I cannot say.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He paused, silent for a moment. Then without another word he turned<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">away from the lights and voices in the fields and tents, and followed by his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">three companions went round into his garden, and trotted down the long<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sloping path. He jumped over a low place in the hedge at the bottom, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">took to the meadows, passing into the night like a rustle of wind in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">grass.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf remained for a while staring after him into the darkness.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™Goodbye, my dear Bilbo - until our next meeting!' he said softly and went<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">back indoors.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo came in soon afterwards, and found him sitting in the dark, deep<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in thought. 'Has he gone?' he asked.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes,' answered Gandalf, 'he has gone at last.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">' I wish - 1 mean, I hoped until this evening that it was only a joke,'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said Frodo. 'But I knew in my heart that he really meant to go. He always<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">used to joke about serious things. I wish I had come back sooner, just to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">see him off.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I think really he preferred slipping off quietly in the end,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf. 'Don't be too troubled. He'll be all right - now. He left a packet<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for you. There it is!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo took the envelope from the mantelpiece, and glanced at it, but<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">did not open it.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You'll find his will and all the other documents in there, I think,'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said the wizard. 'You are the master of Bag End now. And also, I fancy,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you'll find a golden ring.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The ring!' exclaimed Frodo. 'Has he left me that? I wonder why. Still,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it may be useful.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It may, and it may not,' said Gandalf. 'I should not make use of it,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">if I were you. But keep it secret, and keep it safe! Now I am going to bed.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">As master of Bag End Frodo felt it his painful duty to say good-bye to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the guests. Rumours of strange events had by now spread all over the field,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">but Frodo would only say no doubt everything will be cleared up in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">morning. About midnight carriages came for the important folk. One by one<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they rolled away, filled with full but very unsatisfied hobbits. Gardeners<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">came by arrangement, and removed in wheel-barrows those that had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">inadvertently remained behind.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Night slowly passed. The sun rose. The hobbits rose rather later.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Morning went on. People came and began (by orders) to clear away the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pavilions and the tables and the chairs, and the spoons and knives and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">bottles and plates, and the lanterns, and the flowering shrubs in boxes, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the crumbs and cracker -paper, the forgotten bags and gloves and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">handkerchiefs, and the uneaten food (a very small item). Then a number of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">other people came (without orders): Bagginses, and Boffins, and Bolgers, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Tooks, and other guests that lived or were staying near. By mid-day, when<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">even the best-fed were out and about again, there was a large crowd at Bag<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">End, uninvited but not unexpected.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo was waiting on the step, smiling, but looking rather tired and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">worried. He welcomed all the callers, but he had not much more to say than<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">before. His reply to all inquiries was simply this: 'Mr. Bilbo Baggins has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gone away; as far as I know, for good.' Some of the visitors he invited to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">come inside, as Bilbo had left 'messages' for them.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Inside in the hall there was piled a large assortment of packages and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">parcels and small articles of furniture. On every item there was a label<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">tied. There were several labels of this sort:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For ADELARD TOOK, for his VERY OWN, from Bilbo, on an umbrella.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Adelard<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had carried off many unlabelled ones.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For DORA BAGGINS in memory of a LONG correspondence, with love<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo, on a large waste-paper basket. Dora was Drogo's sister and the eldest<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">surviving female relative of Bilbo and Frodo; she was ninety-nine, and had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">written reams of good advice for more than half a century.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For MILO BURROWS, hoping it will be useful, from B.B., on a gold pen<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and ink-bottle. Milo never answered letters.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For ANGELICA'S use, from Uncle Bilbo, on a round convex mirror. She<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a young Baggins, and too obviously considered her face shapely.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For the collection of HUGO BRACEGIRDLE, from a contributor, on an<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">(empty) book -case. Hugo was a great borrower of books, and worse than usual<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">at returning them.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For LOBELIA SACKVILLE-BAGGINS, as a PRESENT, on a case of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">silver<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spoons. Bilbo believed that she had acquired a good many of his spoons,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">while he was away on his former journey. Fobelia knew that quite well. When<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">she arrived later in the day, she took the point at once, but she also took<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the spoons.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">This is only a small selection of the assembled presents. Bilbo's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">residence had got rather cluttered up with things in the course of his long<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">life. It was a tendency of hobbit-holes to get cluttered up: for which the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">custom of giving so many birthday-presents was largely responsible. Not, of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">course, that the birthday-presents were always new, there were one or two<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">old mathoms of forgotten uses that had circulated all around the district;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">but Bilbo had usually given new presents, and kept those that he received.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The old hole was now being cleared a little.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Every one of the various parting gifts had labels, written out<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">personally by Bilbo, and several had some point, or some joke. But, of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">course, most of the things were given where they would be wanted and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">welcome. The poorer hobbits, and especially those of Bagshot Row, did very<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
