<p class="p4"><span class="s3">give him a little surprise, to pay him out for being so late. Let's get out<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of sight!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The other two ran quickly to the left and down into a little hollow not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">far from the road. There they lay flat. Frodo hesitated for a second:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">curiosity or some other feeling was struggling with his desire to hide. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sound of hoofs drew nearer. Just in time he threw himself down in a patch of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">long grass behind a tree that overshadowed the road. Then he lifted his head<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and peered cautiously above one of the great roots.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Round the corner came a black horse, no hobbit-pony but a full-sized<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">horse; and on it sat a large man, who seemed to crouch in the saddle,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wrapped in a great black cloak and hood, so that only his boots in the high<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stirrups showed below; his face was shadowed and invisible.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">When it reached the tree and was level with Frodo the horse stopped.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The riding figure sat quite still with its head bowed, as if listening. From<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">inside the hood came a noise as of someone sniffing to catch an elusive<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">scent; the head turned from side to side of the road.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A sudden unreasoning fear of discovery laid hold of Frodo, and he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thought of his Ring. He hardly dared to breathe, and yet the desire to get<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it out of his pocket became so strong that he began slowly to move his hand.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He felt that he had only to slip it on, and then he would be safe. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">advice of Gandalf seemed absurd. Bilbo had used the Ring. 'And I am still in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Shire,' he thought, as his hand touched the chain on which it hung. At<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that moment the rider sat up, and shook the reins. The horse stepped<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">forward, walking slowly at first, and then breaking into a quick trot.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo crawled to the edge of the road and watched the rider, until he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dwindled into the distance. He could not be quite sure, but it seemed to him<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that suddenly, before it passed out of sight, the horse turned aside and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">went into the trees on the right.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, I call that very queer, and indeed disturbing,' said Frodo to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">himself, as he walked towards his companions. Pippin and Sam had remained<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flat in the grass, and had seen nothing; so Frodo described the rider and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his strange behaviour.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I can't say why, but I felt certain he was looking or smelling for me;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and also I felt certain that I did not want him to discover me. I've never<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seen or fell anything like it in the Shire before.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But what has one of the Big People got to do with us?' said Pippin.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And what is he doing in this part of the world?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There are some Men about,' said Frodo. 'Down in the Southfarthing they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have had trouble with Big People, I believe. But I have never heard of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">anything like this rider. I wonder where he comes from.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Begging your pardon,' put in Sam suddenly, 'I know where he comes<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from. It's from Hobbiton that this here black rider comes, unless there's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more than one. And I know where he's going to.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'What do you mean?' said Frodo sharply, looking at him in astonishment.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Why didn't you speak up before?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I have only just remembered, sir. It was like this: when I got back to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">our hole yesterday evening with the key, my dad, he says to me: Hello, Sam!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he says. I thought you were away with Mr. Frodo this morning. There's been a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">strange customer asking for Mr. Baggins of Bag End, and he's only just gone.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">I've sent him on to Bucklebury. Not that Hiked the sound of him. He seemed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mighty put out, when I told him Mr. Baggins had left his old home for good.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Hissed at me, he did. It gave me quite a shudder. What sort of a fellow was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he? says I to the Gaffer. / don 't know, says he; but he wasn 't a hobbit. He<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was tall and black-like, and he stooped aver me. I reckon it was one of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Big Folk from foreign parts. He spoke funny.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I couldn't stay to hear more, sir, since you were waiting; and I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">didn't give much heed to it myself. The Gaffer is getting old, and more than<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a bit blind, and it must have been near dark when this fellow come up the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Hill and found him taking the air at the end of our Row. I hope he hasn't<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">done no harm, sir, nor me.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The Gaffer can't be blamed anyway,' said Frodo. 'As a matter of fact I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">heard him talking to a stranger, who seemed to be inquiring for me, and I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nearly went and asked him who it was. I wish I had, or you had told me about<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it before. I might have been more careful on the road.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Still, there may be no connexion between this rider and the Gaffer's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stranger,' said Pippin. 'We left Hobbiton secretly enough, and I don't see<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">how he could have followed us.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'What about the smelling, sir?' said Sam. 'And the Gaffer said he was a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">black chap.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I wish I had waited for Gandalf,' Frodo muttered. 'But perhaps it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">would only have made matters worse.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Then you know or guess something about this rider?' said Pippin, who<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had caught the muttered words.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I don't know, and I would rather not guess,' said Frodo. 'All right,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cousin Frodo! You can keep your secret for the present, if you want to be<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mysterious. In the meanwhile what are we to do? I should like a bite and a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sup, but somehow I think we had better move on from here. Your talk of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sniffing riders with invisible noses has unsettled me.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, I think we will move on now,' said Frodo; 'but not on the road<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">-in case that rider comes back, or another follows him. We ought to do a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">good step more today. Buckland is still miles away.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The shadows of the trees were long and thin on the grass, as they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">started off again. They now kept a stone's throw to the left of the road,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and kept out of sight of it as much as they could. But this hindered them;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for the grass was thick and tussocky, and the ground uneven, and the trees<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">began to draw together into thickets.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The sun had gone down red behind the hills at their backs, and evening<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was coming on before they came back to the road at the end of the long level<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">over which it had run straight for some miles. At that point it bent left<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and went down into the lowlands of the Yale making for Stock; but a lane<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">branched right, winding through a wood of ancient oak-trees on its way to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Woodhall. 'That is the way for us,' said Frodo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Not far from the road-meeting they came on the huge hulk of a tree: it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was still alive and had leaves on the small branches that it had put out<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">round the broken stumps of its long-fallen limbs; but it was hollow, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">could be entered by a great crack on the side away from the road. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits crept inside, and sat there upon a floor of old leaves and decayed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wood. They rested and had a light meal, talking quietly and listening from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time to time.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Twilight was about them as they crept back to the lane. The West wind<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was sighing in the branches. Leaves were whispering. Soon the road began to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fall gently but steadily into the dusk. A star came out above the trees in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the darkening East before them. They went abreast and in step, to keep up<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">their spirits. After a time, as the stars grew thicker and brighter, the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">feeling of disquiet left them, and they no longer listened for the sound of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hoofs. They began to hum softly, as hobbits have a way of doing as they walk<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">along, especially when they are drawing near to home at night. With most<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits it is a supper-song or a bed-song; but these hobbits hummed a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">walking-song (though not, of course, without any mention of supper and bed).<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo Baggins had made the words, to a tune that was as old as the hills,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and taught it to Frodo as they walked in the lanes of the Water -valley and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">talked about Adventure.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Upon the hearth the fire is red,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Beneath the roof there is a bed;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">But not yet weary are our feet,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Still round the corner we may meet<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A sudden tree or standing stone<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">That none have seen but we alone.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Tree and flower and leaf and grass,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Let them pass! Let them pass!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Hill and water under sky,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pass them by! Pass them by!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Still round the corner there may wait<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A new road or a secret gate,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And though we pass them by today,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Tomorrow we may come this way<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And take the hidden paths that run<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Towards the Moon or to the Sun.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Apple, thorn, and nut and sloe,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Let them go! Let them go!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sand and stone and pool and dell,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Fare you well! Fare you well!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Home is behind, the world ahead,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And there are many paths to tread<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Through shadows to the edge of night,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Until the stars are all alight.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then world behind and home ahead,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">We'll wander back to home and bed.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Mist and twilight, cloud and shade,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Away shall fade! Away shall fade!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Fire and lamp, and meat and bread,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And then to bed! And then to bed!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The song ended. 'And now to bed! And now to bed!' sang Pippin in a high<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">voice.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Hush!' said Frodo. 'I think I hear hoofs again.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They slopped suddenly and stood as silent as tree-shadows, listening.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was a sound of hoofs in the lane, some way behind, but coming slow and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clear down the wind. Quickly and quietly they slipped off the path, and ran<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">into the deeper shade under the oak-trees.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Don't let us go too far!' said Frodo. 'I don't want to be seen, but I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">want to see if it is another Black Rider.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Very well!' said Pippin. 'But don't forget the sniffing!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The hoofs drew nearer. They had no time to find any hiding-place better<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">than the general darkness under the trees; Sam and Pippin crouched behind a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">large tree-bole, while Frodo crept back a few yards towards the lane. It<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">showed grey and pale, a line of fading light through the wood. Above it the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stars were thick in the dim sky, but there was no moon.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The sound of hoofs stopped. As Frodo watched he saw something dark pass<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">across the lighter space between two trees, and then halt. It looked like<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the black shade of a horse led by a smaller black shadow. The black shadow<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stood close to the point where they had left the path, and it swayed from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">side to side. Frodo thought he heard the sound of snuffling. The shadow bent<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the ground, and then began to crawl towards him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Once more the desire to slip on the Ring came over Frodo; but this time<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it was stronger than before. So strong that, almost before he realized what<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he was doing, his hand was groping in his pocket. But at that moment there<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">came a sound like mingled song and laughter. Clear voices rose and fell in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the starlit air. The black shadow straightened up and retreated. It climbed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on to the shadowy horse and seemed to vanish across the lane into the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">darkness on the other side. Frodo breathed again.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Elves!' exclaimed Sam in a hoarse whisper. 'Elves, sir!' He would have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">burst out of the trees and dashed off towards the voices, if they had not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pulled him back.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, it is Elves,' said Frodo. 'One can meet them sometimes in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Woody End. They don't live in the Shire, but they wander into it in Spring<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and Autumn, out of their own lands away beyond the Tower Hills. I am<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thankful that they do! You did not see, but that Black Rider stopped just<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">here and was actually crawling towards us when the song began. As soon as he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">heard the voices he slipped away.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'What about the Elves?' said Sam, too excited to trouble about the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">rider. 'Can't we go and see them?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Listen! They are coming this way,' said Frodo. 'We have only to wait.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The singing drew nearer. One clear voice rose now above the others. It was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">singing in the fair elven-tongue, of which Frodo knew only a little, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">others knew nothing. Yet the sound blending with the melody seemed to shape<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">itself in their thought into words which they only partly understood. This<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was the song as Frodo heard it:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Snow-white! Snow-white! O Lady clear!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">O Queen beyond the Western Seas!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">O Light to us that wander here<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Amid the world of woven trees!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gilthoniel! O Elbereth!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Clear are thy eyes and bright thy breath!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Snow-white! Snow-white! We sing to thee<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In a far land beyond the Sea.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">O stars that in the Sunless Year<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">With shining hand by her were sawn,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In windy fields now bright and clear<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">We see your silver blossom blown!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">O Elbereth! Gilthoniel!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">We still remember, we who dwell<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In this far land beneath the trees,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Thy starlight on the Western Seas.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The song ended. These are High Elves! They spoke the name of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elbereth!' said Frodo in amazement, 'Few of that fairest folk are ever seen<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in the Shire. Not many now remain in Middle-earth, east of the Great Sea.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">This is indeed a strange chance!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The hobbits sat in shadow by the wayside. Before long the Elves came<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">down the lane towards the valley. They passed slowly, and the hobbits could<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">see the starlight glimmering on their hair and in their eyes. They bore no<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lights, yet as they walked a shimmer, like the light of the moon above the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">rim of the hills before it rises, seemed to fall about their feet. They were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">now silent, and as the last Elf passed he turned and looked towards the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits and laughed.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Hail, Frodo!' he cried. 'You are abroad late. Or are you perhaps<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lost?' Then he called aloud to the others, and all the company stopped and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gathered round.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'This is indeed wonderful!' they said. 'Three hobbits in a wood at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">night! We have not seen such a thing since Bilbo went away. What is the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">meaning of it?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The meaning of it, fair people,' said Frodo, 'is simply that we seem<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to be going the same way as you are. I like walking under the stars. But I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">would welcome your company.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But we have no need of other company, and hobbits are so dull,' they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">laughed. 'And how do you know that we go the same way as you, for you do<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">know whither we are going?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And how do you know my name?' asked Frodo in return.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'We know many things,' they said. 'We have seen you often before with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo, though you may not have seen us.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Who are you, and who is your lord?' asked Frodo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I am Gildor,' answered their leader, the Elf who had first hailed him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Gildor Inglorion of the House of Finrod. We are Exiles, and most of our<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">kindred have long ago departed and we too are now only tarrying here a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">while, ere we return over the Great Sea. But some of our kinsfolk dwell<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">still in peace in Rivendell. Come now, Frodo, tell us what you are doing?<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For we see that there is some shadow of fear upon you.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'O Wise People!' interrupted Pippin eagerly. â€™Tell us about the Black<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Riders!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Black Riders?' they said in low voices. 'Why do you ask about Black<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Riders?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Because two Black Riders have overtaken us today, or one has done so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">twice,' said Pippin; 'only a little while ago he slipped away as you drew<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">near.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Elves did not answer at once, but spoke together softly in their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">own tongue. At length Gildor turned to the hobbits. 'We will not speak of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">this here,' he said. 'We think you had best come now with us. It is not our<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">custom, but for this time we will lake you on our road, and you shall lodge<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with us tonight, if you will.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'O Fair Folk! This is good fortune beyond my hope,' said Pippin. Sam<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was speechless. 'I thank you indeed, Gildor Inglorion,' said Frodo bowing.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Elen snla lÂ®menn' omentielvo, a star shines on the hour of our meeting,' he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">added in the high-elven speech.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Be careful, friends!' cried Gildor laughing. 'Speak no secrets! Here<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">is a scholar in the Ancient Tongue. Bilbo was a good master. Hail,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elf-friend!' he said, bowing to Frodo. 'Come now with your friends and join<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">our company! You had best walk in the middle so that you may not stray. You<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">may be weary before we halt.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Why? Where are you going?' asked Frodo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'For tonight we go to the woods on the hills above Woodhall. It is some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">miles, but you shall have rest at the end of it, and it will shorten your<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">journey tomorrow.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They now marched on again in silence, and passed like shadows and faint<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lights: for Elves (even more than hobbits) could walk when they wished<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">without sound or footfall. Pippin soon began to feel sleepy, and staggered<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">once or twice; but each time a tall Elf at his side put out his arm and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">saved him from a fall. Sam walked along at Frodo's side, as if in a dream,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with an expression on his face half of fear and half of astonished joy.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The woods on either side became denser; the trees were now younger and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thicker; and as the lane went lower, running down into a fold of the hills,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there were many deep brakes of hazel on the rising slopes at either hand. At<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">last the Elves turned aside from the path. A green ride lay almost unseen<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">through the thickets on the right; and this they followed as it wound away<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">back up the wooded slopes on to the top of a shoulder of the hills that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stood out into the lower land of the river -valley. Suddenly they came out of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the shadow of the trees, and before them lay a wide space of grass, grey<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">under the night. On three sides the woods pressed upon it; but eastward the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ground fell steeply and the tops of the dark trees, growing at the bottom of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the slope, were below their feet. Beyond, the low lands lay dim and flat<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">under the stars. Nearer at hand a few lights twinkled in the village of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Woodhall.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Elves sat on the grass and spoke together in soft voices; they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seemed to take no further notice of the hobbits. Frodo and his companions<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wrapped themselves in cloaks and blankets, and drowsiness stole over them.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The night grew on, and the lights in the valley went out. Pippin fell<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">asleep, pillowed on a green hillock.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Away high in the East swung Remmirath, the Netted Stars, and slowly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">above the mists red Borgil rose, glowing like a jewel of fire. Then by some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shift of airs all the mist was drawn away like a veil, and there leaned up,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as he climbed over the rim of the world, the Swordsman of the Sky,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Menelvagor with his shining belt. The Elves all burst into song. Suddenly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">under the trees a fire sprang up with a red light.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Come!' the Elves called to the hobbits. 'Come! Now is the time for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">speech and merriment!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pippin sat up and rubbed his eyes. He shivered. 'There is a fire in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hall, and food for hungry guests,' said an Elf standing before him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At the south end of the greensward there was an opening. There the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">green floor ran on into the wood, and formed a wide space like a hall,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">roofed by the boughs of trees. Their great trunks ran like pillars down each<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">side. In the middle there was a wood-fire blazing, and upon the tree-pillars<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">torches with lights of gold and silver were burning steadily. The Elves sat<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">round the fire upon the grass or upon the sawn rings of old trunks. Some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">went to and fro bearing cups and pouring drink; others brought food on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">heaped plates and dishes.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'This is poor fare,' they said to the hobbits; 'for we are lodging in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the greenwood far from our halls. If ever you are our guests at home, we<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">will treat you better.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It seems to me good enough for a birthday-party,' said Frodo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pippin afterwards recalled little of either food or drink, for his mind<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was filled with the light upon the elf-faces, and the sound of voices so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">various and so beautiful that he felt in a waking dream. But he remembered<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that there was bread, surpassing the savour of a fair white loaf to one who<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">is starving; and fruits sweet as wildberries and richer than the tended<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fruits of gardens; he drained a cup that was filled with a fragrant draught,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cool as a clear fountain, golden as a summer afternoon.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sam could never describe in words, nor picture clearly to himself, what<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he felt or thought that night, though it remained in his memory as one of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the chief events of his life. The nearest he ever got was to say: 'Well,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sir, if I could grow apples like that, I would call myself a gardener. But<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it was the singing that went to my heart, if you know what I mean.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo sat, eating, drinking, and talking with delight; but his mind was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">chiefly on the words spoken. He knew a little of the elf-speech and listened<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">eagerly. Now and again he spoke to those that served him and thanked them in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">their own language. They smiled at him and said laughing: 'Here is a jewel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">among hobbits!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">After a while Pippin fell fast asleep, and was lifted up and borne away<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to a bower under the trees; there he was laid upon a soft bed and slept the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">rest of the night away. Sam refused to leave his master. When Pippin had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gone, he came and sat curled up at Frodo's feet, where at last he nodded and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">closed his eyes. Frodo remained long awake, talking with Gildor.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They spoke of many things, old and new, and Frodo questioned Gildor<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">much about happenings in the wide world outside the Shire. The tidings were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mostly sad and ominous: of gathering darkness, the wars of Men, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flight of the Elves. At last Frodo asked the question that was nearest to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his heart:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Tell me, Gildor, have you ever seen Bilbo since he left us?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gildor smiled. 'Yes,' he answered. 'Twice. He said farewell to us on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">this very spot. But I saw him once again, far from here.' He would say no<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more about Bilbo, and Frodo fell silent.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You do not ask me or tell me much that concerns yourself, Frodo,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gildor. 'But I already know a little, and I can read more in your face and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in the thought behind your questions. You are leaving the Shire, and yet you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">doubt that you will find what you seek, or accomplish what you intend, or<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that you will ever return. Is not that so?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is,' said Frodo; 'but I thought my going was a secret known only to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf and my faithful Sam.' He looked down at Sam, who was snoring<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gently.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The secret will not reach the Enemy from us,' said Gildor.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The Enemy?' said Frodo. 'Then you know why I am leaving the Shire?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I do not know for what reason the Enemy is pursuing you,' answered<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gildor; 'but I perceive that he is - strange indeed though that seems to me.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And I warn you that peril is now both before you and behind you, and upon<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">either side.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You mean the Riders? I feared that they were servants of the Enemy.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">What are the Black Riders?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Has Gandalf told you nothing?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Nothing about such creatures.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Then I think it is not for me to say more - lest terror should keep<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you from your journey. For it seems to me that you have set out only just in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time, if indeed you are in time. You must now make haste, and neither stay<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nor turn back; for the Shire is no longer any protection to you.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I cannot imagine what information could be more terrifying than your<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hints and warnings,' exclaimed Frodo. 'I knew that danger lay ahead, of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">course; but I did not expect to meet it in our own Shire. Can't a hobbit<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">walk from the Water to the River in peace?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But it is not your own Shire,' said Gildor. 'Others dwelt here before<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits were; and others will dwell here again when hobbits are no more. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ever fence it out.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I know - and yet it has always seemed so safe and familiar. What can I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">do now? My plan was to leave the Shire secretly, and make my way to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Rivendell; but now my footsteps are dogged, before ever I get to Buckland.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I think you should still follow that plan,' said Gildor. 'I do not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">think the Road will prove too hard for your courage. But if you desire<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clearer counsel, you should ask Gandalf. I do not know the reason for your<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flight, and therefore I do not know by what means your pursuers will assail<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you. These things Gandalf must know. I suppose that you will see him before<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you leave the Shire?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I hope so. But that is another thing that makes me anxious. I have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">been expecting Gandalf for many days. He was to have come to Hobbiton at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">latest two nights ago; but he has never appeared. Now I am wondering what<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">can have happened. Should I wait for him?â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gildor was silent for a moment. 'I do not like this news,' he said at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">last. 'That Gandalf should be late, does not bode well. But it is said: Do<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">anger. The choice is yours: to go or wait.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And it is also said,' answered Frodo: 'Go not to the Elves for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">counsel, for they will say both no and yes. '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Is it indeed?' laughed Gildor. 'Elves seldom give unguarded advice,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for advice is a dangerous gift, even from the wise to the wise, and all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">courses may run ill. But what would you? You have not told me all concerning<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">yourself; and how then shall I choose better than you? But if you demand<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">advice, I will for friendship's sake give it. I think you should now go at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">once, without delay; and if Gandalf does not come before you set out, then I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">also advise this: do not go alone. Take such friends as are trusty and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">willing. Now you should be grateful, for I do not give this counsel gladly.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows, and they are little<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">concerned with the ways of hobbits, or of any other creatures upon earth.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Our paths cross theirs seldom, by chance or purpose. In this meeting there<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">may be more than chance; but the purpose is not clear to me, and I fear to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">say too much.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I am deeply grateful,' said Frodo; 'but I wish you would tell me<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">plainly what the Black Riders are. If I take your advice I may not see<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf for a long while, and I ought to know what is the danger that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pursues me.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Is it not enough to know that they are servants of the Enemy?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">answered Gildor. 'Flee them! Speak no words to them! They are deadly. Ask no<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more of me! But my heart forbodes that, ere all is ended, you, Frodo son of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Drogo, will know more of these fell things than Gildor Inglorion. May<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elbereth protect you!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But where shall I find courage?' asked Frodo. 'That is what I chiefly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">need.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Courage is found in unlikely places,' said Gildor. 'Be of good hope!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sleep now! In the morning we shall have gone; but we will send our messages<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">through the lands. The Wandering Companies shall know of your journey,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">those that have power for good shall be on the watch. I name you Elf-friend;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and may the stars shine upon the end of your road! Seldom have we had such<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">delight in strangers, and it is fair to hear words of the Ancient Speech<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from the lips of other wanderers in the world.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo felt sleep coming upon him, even as Gildor finished speaking. 'I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">will sleep now,' he said; and the Elf led him to a bower beside Pippin, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he threw himself upon a bed and fell at once into a dreamless slumber.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Chapter 4 . A Short Cut to Mushrooms<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In the morning Frodo woke refreshed. He was lying in a bower made by a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">living tree with branches laced and drooping to the ground; his bed was of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fern and grass, deep and soft and strangely fragrant. The sun was shining<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">through the fluttering leaves, which were still green upon the tree. He<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">jumped up and went out.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sam was sitting on the grass near the edge of the wood. Pippin was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">standing studying the sky and weather. There was no sign of the Elves.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'They have left us fruit and drink, and bread,' said Pippin. 'Come and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have your breakfast. The bread tastes almost as good as it did last night. I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">did not want to leave you any, but Sam insisted.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo sat down beside Sam and began to eat. 'What is the plan for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">today?' asked Pippin.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'To walk to Bucklebury as quickly as possible,' answered Frodo, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gave his attention to the food.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Do you think we shall see anything of those Riders?' asked Pippin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cheerfully. Under the morning sun the prospect of seeing a whole troop of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">them did not seem very alarming to him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes, probably,' said Frodo, not liking the reminder. 'But I hope to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">get across the river without their seeing us.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Did you find out anything about them from Gildor?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Not much - only hints and riddles,' said Frodo evasively. 'Did you ask<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">about the sniffing?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'We didn't discuss it,' said Frodo with his mouth full.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You should have. I am sure it is very important.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'In that case I am sure Gildor would have refused to explain it,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo sharply. 'And now leave me in peace for a bit! I don't want to answer<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a string of questions while I am eating. I want to think!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Good heavens!' said Pippin. 'At breakfast?' He walked away towards the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">edge of the green.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">From Frodo' s mind the bright morning - treacherously bright, he thought<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">- had not banished the fear of pursuit; and he pondered the words of Gildor.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The merry voice of Pippin came to him. He was running on the green turf and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">singing.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'No! I could not!' he said to himself. 'It is one thing to take my<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">young friends walking over the Shire with me, until we are hungry and weary,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and food and bed are sweet. To take them into exile, where hunger and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">weariness may have no cure, is quite another - even if they are willing to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">come. The inheritance is mine alone. I don't think I ought even to take<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sam.' He looked at Sam Gamgee, and discovered that Sam was watching him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, Sam!' he said. 'What about it? I am leaving the Shire as soon as<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ever I can - in fact I have made up my mind now not even to wait a day at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Crickhollow, if it can be helped.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Very good, sir!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You still mean to come with me?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I do.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is going to be very dangerous, Sam. 'It is already dangerous. Most<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">likely neither of us will come back.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'If you don't come back, sir, then I shan't, that's certain,' said Sam.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
