<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Edrendil was a mariner<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that tarried in Arvernien;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he built a boat of timber felled<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in Nimbrethil to journey in;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">her sails he wove of silver fair,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of silver were her lanterns made,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">her prow was fashioned like a swan,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and light upon her banners laid.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In panoply of ancient kings,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in chain, d rings he armoured him;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his shining shield was scored with runes<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to ward all wounds and harm from him;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his bow was made of dragon-horn,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his arrows shorn of ebony,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of silver was his habergeon,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his scabbard of chalcedony;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his sword of steel was valiant,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of adamant his helmet tall,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">an eagle-plume upon his crest,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">upon his breast an emerald.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Beneath the Moon and under star<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he wandered far from northern strands,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">bewildered on enchanted ways<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beyond the days of mortal lands.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">From gnashing of the Narrow Ice<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where shadow lies on frozen hills,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from nether heats and burning waste<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he turned in haste, and roving still<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on starless waters far astray<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">at last he came to Night of Naught,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and passed, and never sight he saw<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of shining shore nor light he sought.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The winds of wrath came driving him,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and blindly in the foam he fled<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from west to east and errandless,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">unheralded he homeward sped.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There flying Elwing came to him,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and flame was in the darkness lit;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more bright than light of diamond<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the fire upon her carcanet.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Silmaril she bound on him<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and crowned him with the living light<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and dauntless then with burning brow<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he turned his prow; and in the night<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from Otherworld beyond the Sea<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there strong and free a storm arose,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a wind of power in Tarmenel;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">by paths that seldom mortal goes<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his boat it bore with biting breath<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as might of death across the grey<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and long-forsaken seas distressed:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from east to west he passed away.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Through Evernight he back was borne<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on black and roaring waves that ran<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">o'er leagues unlit and foundered shores<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that drowned before the Days began,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">until he heard on strands of pearl<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">when ends the world the music long,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where ever foaming billows roll<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the yellow gold and jewels wan.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He saw the Mountain silent rise<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where twilight lies upon the knees<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of Valinor, and Eldamar<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beheld afar beyond the seas.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A wanderer escaped from night<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to haven white he came at last,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to Elvenhome the green and fair<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where keen the air, where pale as glass<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beneath the Hill of Ilmarin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a-glimmer in a valley sheer<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the lamplit towers ofTirion<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">are mirrored on the Shadowmere.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He tarried there from errantry,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and melodies they taught to him,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and sages old him marvels told,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and harps of gold they brought to him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They clothed him then in elven-white,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and seven lights before him sent,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as through the Calacirian<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to hidden land forlorn he went.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He came unto the timeless halls<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where shining fall the countless years,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and endless reigns the Elder King<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in Ilmarin on Mountain sheer;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and words unheard were spoken then<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of folk of Men and Elven-kin,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beyond the world were visions showed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">forbid to those that dwell therein.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A ship then new they built for him<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of mithril and of elven-glass<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with shining prow; no shaven oar<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nor sail she bore on silver mast:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Silmaril as lantern light<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and banner bright with living flame<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to gleam thereon by Elbereth<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">herself was set, who thither came<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and wings immortal made for him,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and laid on him undying doom,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to sail the shoreless skies and come<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">behind the Sun and light of Moon.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">From Evereven's lofty hills<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where softly silver fountains fall<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his wings him bore, a wandering light,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beyond the mighty Mountain Wall.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">From World's End then he turned away<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and yearned again to find afar<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his home through shadows journeying,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and burning as an island star<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on high above the mists he came,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a distant flame before the Sun,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a wonder ere the waking dawn<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">where grey the Norland waters run.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And over Middle-earth he passed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and heard at last the weeping sore<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of women and of elven-maids<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in Elder Days, in years of yore,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gut on him mighty doom was laid,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">till Moon should fade, an orb,d star<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to pass, and tarry never more<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">on Hither Shores where mortals are;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for ever still a herald on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">an errand that should never rest<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to bear his shining lamp afar,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Flammifer of Westernesse.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The chanting ceased. Frodo opened his eyes and saw that Bilbo was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seated on his stool in a circle of listeners, who were smiling and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">applauding.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Now we had better have it again,' said an Elf.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo got up and bowed. 'I am flattered, Lindir,â€™ he said. 'But it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">would be too tiring to repeat it all.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Not too tiring for you,' the Elves answered laughing. 'You know you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">are never tired of reciting your own verses. But really we cannot answer<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">your question at one hearing!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'What!' cried Bilbo. 'You can't tell which parts were mine, and which<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were the DÂ®nadan's?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is not easy for us to tell the difference between two mortals' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Elf.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Nonsense, Lindir,' snorted Bilbo. 'If you can't distinguish between a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Man and a Hobbit, your judgement is poorer than I imagined. They're as<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">different as peas and apples.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Maybe. To sheep other sheep no doubt appear different,' laughed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Lindir. 'Or to shepherds. But Mortals have not been our study. We have other<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">business.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I won't argue with you,' said Bilbo. 'I am sleepy after so much music<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and singing. I'll leave you to guess, if you want to.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He got up and came towards Frodo. 'Well, that's over,' he said in a low<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">voice. 'It went off better than I expected. I don't often get asked for a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">second hearing. What did you think of it?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I am not going to try and guess,' said Frodo smiling.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You needn't,â€™ said Bilbo. 'As a matter of fact it was all mine. Except<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that Aragorn insisted on my putting in a green stone. He seemed to think it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">important. I don't know why. Otherwise he obviously thought the whole thing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">rather above my head, and he said that if I had the cheek to make verses<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">about Edrendil in the house of Elrond, it was my affair. I suppose he was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">right.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I don't know,' said Frodo. 'It seemed to me to fit somehow, though I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">can't explain. I was half asleep when you began, and it seemed to follow on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from something that I was dreaming about. I didn't understand that it was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">really you speaking until near the end.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is difficult to keep awake here, until you get used to it;' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Bilbo. 'Not that hobbits would ever acquire quite the elvish appetite for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">music and poetry and tales. They seem to like them as much as food, or more.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They will be going on for a long time yet. What do you say to slipping off<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for some more quiet talk?'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Can we?â€™ said Frodo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Of course. This is merrymaking not business. Come and go as you like,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as long as you don't make a noise.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They got up and withdrew quietly into the shadows, and made for the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">doors. Sam they left behind, fast asleep still with a smile on his face. In<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spite of his delight in Bilbo's company Frodo felt a tug of regret as they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">passed out of the Hall of Fire. Even as they stepped over the threshold a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">single clear voice rose in song.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A Elbereth Gilthoniel,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">silivren penna mnriel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">o menel aglar elenath!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Na-chaered palan-dnriel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">o galadhremmin ennorath,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Fanuilos, le linnathon<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nef aear, sn nef aearon!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo halted for a moment, looking back. Elrond was in his chair and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the fire was on his face like summer -light upon the trees. Near him sat the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Lady Arwen. To his surprise Frodo saw that Aragorn stood beside her; his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dark cloak was thrown back, and he seemed to be clad in elven-mail, and a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">star shone on his breast. They spoke together, and then suddenly it seemed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to Frodo that Arwen turned towards him, and the light of her eyes fell on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">him from afar and pierced his heart.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He stood still enchanted, while the sweet syllables of the elvish song<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fell like clear jewels of blended word and melody. ' It is a song to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elbereth,' said Bilbo. 'They will sing that, and other songs of the Blessed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Realm, many times tonight. Come on!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He led Frodo back to his own little room. It opened on to the gar dens<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and looked south across the ravine of the Bruinen. There they sat for some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">while, looking through the window at the bright stars above the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">steep-climbing woods, and talking softly. They spoke no more of the small<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">news of the Shire far away, nor of the dark shadows and perils that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">encompassed them, but of the fair things they had seen in the world<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">together, of the Elves, of the stars, of trees, and the gentle fall of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">bright year in the woods.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At last there came a knock on the door. 'Begging your pardon,â€™ said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sam, putting in his head, 'but I was just wondering if you would be wanting<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">anything.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And begging yours, Sam Gamgee,' replied Bilbo. 'I guess you mean that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it is time your master went to bed.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, sir, there is a Council early tomorrow, I hear and he only got<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">up today for the first time.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Quite right, Sam,' laughed Bilbo. 'You can trot off and tell Gandalf<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that he has gone to bed. Good night, Frodo! Bless me, but it has been good<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to see you again! There are no folk like hobbits after all for a real good<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">talk. I am getting very old, and I began to wonder if I should ever live to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">see your chapters of our story. Good night! I'll take a walk, I think, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">look at the stars of Elbereth in the garden. Sleep well!'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Chapter 2 . The Council of Elrond<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Next day Frodo woke early, feeling refreshed and well. He walked along<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the terraces above the loud-flowing Bruinen and watched the pale, cool sun<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">rise above the far mountains, and shine down. Slanting through the thin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">silver mist; the dew upon the yellow leaves was glimmering, and the woven<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nets of gossamer twinkled on every bush. Sam walked beside him, saying<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nothing, but sniffing the air, and looking every now and again with wonder<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in his eyes at the great heights in the East. The snow was white upon their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">peaks.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">On a seat cut in the stone beside a turn in the path they came upon<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf and Bilbo deep in talk. 'Hullo! Good morning!' said Bilbo. 'Feel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ready for the great council?â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I feel ready for anything,' answered Frodo. 'But most of all I should<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">like to go walking today and explore the valley. I should like to get into<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">those pine- woods up there.' He pointed away far up the side of Rivendell to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the north.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You may have a chance later,' said Gandalf. 'But we cannot make any<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">plans yet. There is much to hear and decide today.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Suddenly as they were talking a single clear bell rang out. 'That is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the warning bell for the Council of Elrond,' cried Gandalf. 'Come along now!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Both you and Bilbo are wanted.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo and Bilbo followed the wizard quickly along the winding path back<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the house; behind them, uninvited and for the moment forgotten, trotted<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Sam.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf led them to the porch where Frodo had found his friends the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">evening before. The light of the clear autumn morning was now glowing in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">valley. The noise of bubbling waters came up from the foaming river-bed.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Birds were singing, and a wholesome peace lay on the land. To Frodo his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dangerous flight, and the rumours of the darkness growing in the world<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">outside, already seemed only the memories of a troubled dream; but the faces<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that were turned to meet them as they entered were grave.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elrond was there, and several others were seated in silence about him.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo saw Glorfindel and Gluin; and in a corner alone Strider was sitting,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clad in his old travel-worn clothes again. Elrond drew Frodo to a seat by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his side, and presented him to the company, saying:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Here, my friends is the hobbit, Frodo son of Drogo. Few have ever come<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hither through greater peril or on an errand more urgent.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He then pointed out and named those whom Frodo had not met before.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was a younger dwarf at Gluin's side: his son Gimli. Beside Glorfindel<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there were several other counsellors of Elrond's household, of whom Erestor<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">was the chief; and with him was Galdor, an Elf from the Grey Havens who had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">come on an errand from Cnrdan the Shipwright. There was also a strange Elf<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">clad in green and brown, Legolas, a messenger from his father, Thranduil,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the King of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood. And seated a little apart was a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">tall man with a fair and noble face, dark-haired and grey-eyed, proud and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stern of glance.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He was cloaked and booted as if for a journey on horseback; and indeed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">though his garments were rich, and his cloak was lined with fur, they were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stained with long travel. He had a collar of silver in which a single white<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stone was set; his locks were shorn about his shoulders. On a baldric he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wore a great horn tipped with silver that now was laid upon his knees. He<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gazed at Frodo and Bilbo with sudden wonder.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Here,' said Elrond, turning to Gandalf, 'is Boromir, a man from the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">South. He arrived in the grey morning, and seeks for counsel. I have bidden<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">him to be present, for here his questions will be answered.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Not all that was spoken and debated in the Council need now be told.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Much was said of events in the world outside, especially in the South, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in the wide lands east of the Mountains. Of these things Frodo had already<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">heard many rumours; but the tale of Gluin was new to him, and when the dwarf<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spoke he listened attentively. It appeared that amid the splendour of their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">works of hand the hearts of the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">troubled.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is now many years ago,' said Gluin, 'that a shadow of disquiet fell<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">upon our people. Whence it came we did not at first perceive. Words began to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">be whispered in secret-: it was said that we were hemmed in a narrow place,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and that greater wealth and splendour would be found in a wider world. Some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">spoke of Moria: the mighty works of our fathers that are called in our own<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">tongue Khazad-dym; and they declared that now at last we had the power and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">numbers to return.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gluin sighed. 'Moria! Moria! Wonder of the Northern world! Too deep we<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">delved there, and woke the nameless fear. Long have its vast mansions lain<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">empty since the children of Durin fled. But now we spoke of it again with<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">longing, and yet with dread; for no dwarf has dared to pass the doors of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Khazad-dym for many lives of kings, save Thrur only, and he perished. At<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">last, however, Balin listened to the whispers, and resolved to go; and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">though Dbin did not give leave willingly, he took with him Ori and Uin and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">many of our folk, and they went away south.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">"That was nigh on thirty years ago. For a while we had news and it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seemed good: messages reported that Moria had been entered and a great work<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">begun there. Then there was silence, and no word has ever come from Moria<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">since.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">"Then about a year ago a messenger came to Dbin, but not from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Moria -from Mordor: a horseman in the night, who called Dbin to his gate. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Lord Sauron the Great, so he said, wished for our friendship. Rings he would<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">give for it, such as he gave of old. And he asked urgently concerning<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hobbits, of what kind they were, and where they dwelt. "For Sauron knows,"<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said he, "that one of these was known to you on a time."<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'At this we were greatly troubled, and we gave no answer. And then his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fell voice was lowered, and he would have sweetened it if he could. "As a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">small token only of your friendship Sauron asks this," he said: "that you<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">should find this thief," such was his word, "and get from him, willing or<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">no, a little ring, the least of rings, that once he stole. It is but a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">trifle that Sauron fancies, and an earnest of your good will. Find it, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">three rings that the Dwarf sires possessed of old shall be returned to you,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and the realm of Moria shall be yours for ever. Find only news of the thief,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">whether he still lives and where, and you shall have great reward and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lasting friendship from the Lord. Refuse, and things will not seem so well.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Do you refuse?"<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'At that his breath came like the hiss of snakes, and all who stood by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shuddered, but Dbin said: "I say neither yea nor nay. I must consider this<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">message and what it means under its fair cloak."<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">' "Consider well, but not too long," said he.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">" "The time of my thought is my own to spend," answered Dbin.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">' "For the present," said he, and rode into the darkness.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Heavy have the hearts of our chieftains been since that night. We<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">needed not the fell voice of the messenger to warn us that his words held<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">both menace and deceit; for we knew already that the power that has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">re-entered Mordor has not changed, and ever it betrayed us of old. Twice the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">messenger has returned, and has gone unanswered. The third and last time, so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he says, is soon to come, before the ending of the year.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And so I have been sent at last by Dbin to warn Bilbo that he is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sought by the Enemy, and to learn, if may be, why he desires this ring, this<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">least of rings. Also we crave the advice of Elrond. For the Shadow grows and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">draws nearer. We discover that messengers have come also to King Brand in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Dale, and that he is afraid. We fear that he may yield. Already war is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gathering on his eastern borders. If we make no answer, the Enemy may move<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Men of his rule to assail King Brand, and Dbin also.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You have done well to come,' said Elrond. 'You will hear today all<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that you need in order to understand the purposes of the Enemy. There is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">naught that you can do, other than to resist, with hope or without it. But<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">you do not stand alone. You will learn that your trouble is but part of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">trouble of all the western world. The Ring ! What shall we do with the Ring,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the least of rings, the trifle that Sauron fancies? That is the doom that we<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">must deem.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'That is the purpose for which you are called hither. Called, I say.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">though I have not called you to me, strangers from distant lands. You have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">come and are here met, in this very nick of time, by chance as it may seem.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Yet it is not so. Believe rather that it is so ordered that we, who sit<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">here, and none others, must now find counsel for the peril of the world.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Now, therefore, things shall be openly spoken that have been hidden<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">from all but a few until this day. And first, so that all may understand<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">even to this present. And I will begin that tale, though others shall end<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then all listened while Elrond in his clear voice spoke of Sauron and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Rings of Power, and their forging in the Second Age of the world long<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ago. A part of his tale was known to some there, but the full tale to none,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and many eyes were turned t= Elrond in fear and wonder as he told of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elven-smiths of Eregion and their friendship with Moria, and their eagerness<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">for knowledge, by which Sauron ensnared them. For in that time he was not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">yet evil to behold, and they received his aid and grew mighty in craft,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">whereas he learned all their secrets, and betrayed them, and forged secretly<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in the Mountain of Fire the One Ring to be their master. But Celebrimbor was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">aware of him, and hid the Three which he had made; and there was war, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the land was laid waste, and the gate of Moria was shut.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then through all the years that followed he traced the Ring; but since<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his books of lore, it is not here recalled. For it is a long tale, full of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">deeds great and terrible, and briefly though Elrond spoke, the sun rode up<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the sky, and the morning was passing ere he ceased.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Of NÂ®menor he spoke, its glory and its fall, and the return of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Kings of Men to Middle-earth out of the deeps of the Sea, borne upon the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wings of storm. Then Elendil the Tall and his mighty sons, Isildur and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Anbrion, became great lords; and the North-realm they made in Arnor, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">South-realm in Gondor above the mouths of Anduin. But Sauron of Mordor<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">assailed them, and they made the Last Alliance of Elves and Men, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hosts of Gil-galad and Elendil were mustered in Arnor.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Thereupon Elrond paused a while and sighed. 'I remember well the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">splendour of their banners,' he said. v It recalled to me the glory of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Elder Days and the hosts of Beleriand, so many great princes and captains<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were assembled. And yet not so many, nor so fair, as when Thangorodrim was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">broken, and the Elves deemed that evil was ended for ever, and it was not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">so.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You remember?â€™ said Frodo, speaking his thought aloud in his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">astonishment. 'But I thought,' he stammered as Elrond turned towards him, 'I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thought that the fall of Gil-galad was a long age ago.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'So it was indeed,' answered Elrond gravely. 'But my memory reaches<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">back even to the Elder Days. Edrendil was my sire, who was born in Gondolin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">before its fall; and my mother was Elwing, daughter of Dior, son of LÂ®thien<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of Doriath. I have seen three ages in the West of the world, and many<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">defeats, and many fruitless victories.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I was the herald of Gil-galad and marched with his host. I was at the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Battle of Dagorlad before the Black Gate of Mordor, where we had the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mastery: for the Spear of Gil-galad and the Sword of Elendil, Aiglos and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Narsil, none could withstand. I beheld the last combat on the slopes of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Orodruin, where Gil-galad died, and Elendil fell, and Narsil broke beneath<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hand with the hilt-shard of his father's sword, and took it for his own.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At this the stranger, Boromir, broke in. 'So that is what became of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Ring!' he cried. 'If ever such a tale was told in the South, it has long<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">been forgotten. I have heard of the Great Ring of him that we do not name;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">but we believed that it perished from the world in the ruin of his first<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">realm. Isildur took it! That is tidings indeed.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Alas! yes,' said Elrond. 'Isildur took it, as should not have been. It<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">should have been cast then into Orodruin's fire nigh at hand where it was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">made. But few marked what Isildur did. He alone stood by his father in that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">last mortal contest; and by Gil-galad only Cnrdan stood, and I. But Isildur<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">would not listen to our counsel.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™ "This I will have as weregild for my father, and my brother," he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said; and therefore whether we would or no, he took it to treasure it. But<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">soon he was betrayed by it to his death; and so it is named in the North<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Only to the North did these tidings come, and only to a few. Small<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">wonder it is that you have not heard them, Boromir. From the ruin of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gladden Fields, where Isildur perished, three men only came ever back over<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the mountains after long wandering. One of these was Ohtar, the esquire of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Isildur, who bore the shards of the sword of Elendil; and he brought them to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Valandil, the heir of Isildur, who being but a child had remained here in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Rivendell. But Narsil was broken and its light extinguished, and it has not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">yet been forged again.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Fruitless did I call the victory of the Fast Alliance? Not wholly so,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">yet it did not achieve its end. Sauron was diminished, but not destroyed.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">His Ring was lost but not unmade. The Dark Tower was broken, but its<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">foundations were not removed; for they were made with the power of the Ring,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and while it remains they will endure. Many Elves and many mighty Men,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">many of their friends, had perished in the war. Anbrion was slain, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Isildur was slain; and Gil-galad and Elendil were no more. Never again shall<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there be any such league of Elves and Men; for Men multiply and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Firstborn decrease, and the two kindreds are estranged. And ever since that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">day the race of NÂ®menor has decayed, and the span of their years has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lessened.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'In the North after the war and the slaughter of the Gladden Fields the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Men of Westernesse were diminished, and their city of AnnÂ®minas beside<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Fake<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Evendim fell into ruin; and the heirs of Valandil removed and dwelt at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Deadmen's Dike, and they fear to tread there. For the folk of Arnor<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dwindled, and their foes devoured them, and their lordship passed, leaving<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'In the South the realm of Gondor long endured; and for a while its<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">splendour grew, recalling somewhat of the might of NÂ®menor, ere it fell.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">High towers that people built, and strong places, and havens of many ships;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and the winged crown of the Kings of Men was held in awe by folk of many<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">tongues. Their chief city was Osgiliath, Citadel of the Stars, through the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">midst of which the River flowed. And Minas Ithil they built, Tower of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Rising Moon, eastward upon a shoulder of the Mountains of Shadow; and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">westward at the feet of the White Mountains Minas Anor they made, Tower of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the Setting Sun. There in the courts of the King grew a white tree, from the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seed of that tree which Isildur brought over the deep waters, and the seed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of that tree before came from Eressla, and before that out of the Uttermost<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">West in the Day before days when the world was young.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'But in the wearing of the swift years of Middle-earth the line of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Meneldil son of Anbrion failed, and the Tree withered, and the blood of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">NÂ®menoreans became mingled with that of lesser men. Then the watch upon<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">walls of Mordor slept, and dark things crept back to Gorgoroth. And on a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time evil things came forth, and they took Minas Ithil and abode in it, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they made it into a place of dread; and it is called Minas Morgul, the Tower<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of Sorcery. Then Minas Anor was named anew Minas Tirith, the Tower of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and these two cities were ever at war, but Osgiliath which lay between was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">deserted and in its ruins shadows walked.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'So it has been for many lives of men. But the Lords of Minas Tirith<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">still fight on, defying our enemies, keeping the passage of the River from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Argonath to the Sea. And now that part of the tale that I shall tell is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">drawn to its close. For in the days of Isildur the Ruling Ring passed out of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">all knowledge, and the Three were released from its dominion. But now in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">this latter day they are in peril once more, for to our sorrow the One has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">been found. Others shall speak of its finding, for in that I played small<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">part.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He ceased, but at once Boromir stood up, tall and proud, before them.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Give me leave, Master Elrond, said he, first to say more of Gondor; for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">verily from the land of Gondor I am come. And it would be well for all to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">know what passes there. For few, I deem, know of our deeds, and therefore<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">guess little of their peril, if we should fail at last.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Believe not that in the land of Gondor the blood of NÂ®menor is spent,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nor all its pride and dignity forgotten. By our valour the wild folk of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the West. But if the passages of the River should be won, what then?<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yet that hour, maybe, is not now far away. The Nameless Enemy has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">arisen again. Smoke rises once more from Orodruin that we call Mount<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Doom.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The power of the Black Land grows and we are hard beset. When the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Enemy<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">returned our folk were driven from Ithilien, our fair domain east of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">River, though we kept a foothold there and strength of arms. But this very<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">year, in the days of June, sudden war came upon us out of Mordor, and we<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were swept away. We were outnumbered, for Mordor has allied itself with the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Easterlings and the cruel Elaradrim; but it was not by numbers that we were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Some said that it could be seen, like a great black horseman, a dark<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shadow under the moon. Wherever he came a madness filled our foes, but fear<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fell on our boldest, so that horse and man gave way and fled. Only a remnant<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of our eastern force came back, destroying the last bridge that still stood<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">amid the ruins of Osgiliath.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™I was in the company that held the bridge, until it was cast down<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">behind us. Four only were saved by swimming: my brother and myself and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">two<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">others. But still we fight on, holding all the west shores of Anduin; and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">those who shelter behind us give us praise, if ever they hear our name: much<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'In this evil hour I have come on an errand over many dangerous leagues<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to Elrond: a hundred and ten days I have journeyed all alone. But I do not<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seek allies in war. The might of Elrond is in wisdom not in weapons, it is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">said. I come to ask for counsel and the unravelling of hard words. For on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™In that dream I thought the eastern sky grew dark and there was a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Seek for the Sword that was broken:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In Imladris it dwells;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There shall be counsels taken<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Stronger than Morgul-spells.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There shall be shown a token<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">That Doom is near at hand,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For Isildur's Bane shall waken,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">And the Halfling forth shall stand.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Of these words we could understand little, and we spoke to our father,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Denethor, Lord of Minas Tirith, wise in the lore of Gondor. This only would<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dale, where Elrond the Halfelven dwelt, greatest of lore-masters. Therefore<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">my brother, seeing how desperate was our need, was eager to heed the dream<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">took the journey upon myself. Loth was my father to give me leave, and long<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It does not belong to either of us,' said Aragorn; 'but it has been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Bring out the Ring, Frodo!' said Gandalf solemnly. 'The time has come.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was a hush, and all turned their eyes on Frodo. He was shaken by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and a loathing of its touch. He wished he was far away. The Ring gleamed and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
