<p class="p4"><span class="s3">journey, if never on one so dark; and there are tales of Rivendell of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">greater deeds of his than any that I have seen. He will not go astray-if<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">there is any path to find. He has led us in here against our fears, but he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">will lead us out again, at whatever cost to himself. He is surer of finding<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the way home in a blind night than the cats of Queen BerÂ®thiel.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was well for the Company that they had such a guide. They had no<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fuel nor any means of making torches; in the desperate scramble at the doors<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">many things had been left behind. But without any light they would soon have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">come to grief. There were not only many roads to choose from, there were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">also in many places holes and pitfalls, and dark wells beside the path in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">which their passing feet echoed. There were fissures and chasms in the walls<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and floor, and every now and then a crack would open right before their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">feet. The widest was more than seven feet across, and it was long before<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pippin could summon enough courage to leap over the dreadful gap. The noise<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of churning water came up from far below, as if some great mill-wheel was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">turning in the depths.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Rope! ' muttered Sam. 'I knew I'd want it, if I hadn't got it! '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">As these dangers became more frequent their march became slower.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Already they seemed to have been tramping on, on, endlessly to the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">mountains' roots. They were more than weary, and yet there seemed no comfort<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in the thought of halting anywhere. Frodo's spirits had risen for a while<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">after his escape, and after food and a draught of the cordial; but now a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">deep uneasiness, growing to dread, crept over him again. Though he had been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">healed in Rivendell of the knife-stroke, that grim wound had not been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">without effect. His senses were sharper and more aware of things that could<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not be seen. One sign of change that he soon had noticed was that he could<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">see more in the dark than any of his companions, save perhaps Gandalf. And<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">he was in any case the bearer of the Ring: it hung upon its chain against<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">his breast, and at whiles it seemed a heavy weight. He felt the certainty of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">evil ahead and of evil following; but he said nothing. He gripped tighter on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the hilt of his sword and went on doggedly.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Company behind him spoke seldom, and then only in hurried whispers.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was no sound but the sound of their own feet; the dull stump of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gimli's dwarf-boots; the heavy tread of Boromir; the light step of Legolas;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the soft, scarce-heard patter of hobbit-feet; and in the rear the slow firm<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">footfalls of Aragorn with his long stride. When they halted for a moment<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">they heard nothing at all, unless it were occasionally a faint trickle and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">drip of unseen water. Yet Frodo began to hear, or to imagine that he heard,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">something else: like the faint fall of soft bare feet. It was never loud<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">enough, or near enough, for him to feel certain that he heard it; but once<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">it had started it never stopped, while the Company was moving. But it was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not an echo, for when they halted it pattered on for a little all by itself,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and then grew still.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was after nightfall when they had entered the Mines. They had been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">going for several hours with only brief halts, when Gandalf came to his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">first serious check. Before him stood a wide dark arch opening into three<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">passages: all led in the same general direction, eastwards; but the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">left-hand passage plunged down, while the right-hand climbed up, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">middle way seemed to run on, smooth and level but very narrow.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I have no memory of this place at all!' said Gandalf, standing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">uncertainly under the arch. He held up his staff in the hope of finding some<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">marks or inscription that might help his choice; but nothing of the kind was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to be seen. I am too weary to decide,' he said, shaking his head. 'And I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">expect that you are all as weary as I am, or wearier. We had better halt<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">here for what is left of the night. You know what I mean! In here it is ever<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dark; but outside the late Moon is riding westward and the middle-night has<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">passed.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Poor old Bill! ' said Sam. 'I wonder where he is. I hope those wolves<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">haven't got him yet.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">To the left of the great arch they found a stone door: it was half<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">closed, but swung back easily to a gentle thrust. Beyond there seemed to lie<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a wide chamber cut in the rock.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Steady! Steady! ' cried Gandalf as Merry and Pippin pushed forward,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">glad to find a place where they could rest with at least more feeling of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">shelter than in the open passage. 'Steady! You do not know what is inside<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">yet. I will go first.â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He went in cautiously, and the others filed behind. 'There! â€™ he said,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">pointing with his staff to the middle of the floor. Before his feet they saw<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a large round hole like the mouth of a well. Broken and rusty chains lay at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the edge and trailed down into the black pit. Fragments of stone lay near.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'One of you might have fallen in and still be wondering when you were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">going to strike the bottom,' said Aragorn to Merry. 'Let the guide go first<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">while you have one.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'This seems to have been a guardroom, made for the watching of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">three passages,' said Gimli. 'That hole was plainly a well for the guards'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">use, covered with a stone lid. But the lid is broken, and we must all take<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">care in the dark.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pippin felt curiously attracted by the well. While the others were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">unrolling blankets and making beds against the walls of the chamber, as far<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as possible from the hole in the floor, he crept to the edge and peered<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">over. A chill air seemed to strike his face, rising from invisible depths.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Moved by a sudden impulse he groped for a loose stone, and let it drop. He<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">felt his heart beat many times before there was any sound. Then far below,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">as if the stone had fallen into deep water in some cavernous place, there<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">came a plunk , very distant, but magnified and repeated in the hollow shaft.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'What's that? ' cried Gandalf. He was relieved when Pippin confessed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">what he had done; but he was angry, and Pippin could see his eye glinting.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™Fool of a Took! ' he growled. 'This is a serious journey, not a hobbit<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">walking -party. Throw yourself in next time, and then you will be no further<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nuisance. Now be quiet! '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Nothing more was heard for several minutes; but then there came out of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the depths faint knocks: tom-tap, tap-tom. They stopped, and when the echoes<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had died away, they were repeated: tap-tom, tom-tap, tap-tap, tom. They<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sounded disquietingly like signals of some sort; but after a while the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">knocking died away and was not heard again.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'That was the sound of a hammer, or I have never heard one,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gimli.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Yes,' said Gandalf, 'and I do not like it. It may have nothing to do<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">with Peregrin's foolish stone; but probably something has been disturbed<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that would have been better left quiet. Pray, do nothing of the kind again!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Let us hope we shall get some rest without further trouble. You, Pippin, can<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">go on the first watch, as a reward,' he growled, as he rolled himself in a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">blanket.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Pippin sat miserably by the door in the pitch dark; but he kept on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">turning round, fearing that some unknown thing would crawl up out of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">well. He wished he could cover the hole, if only with a blanket, but he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">dared not move or go near it, even though Gandalf seemed to be asleep.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Actually Gandalf was awake, though lying still and silent. He was deep<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">in thought, trying to recall every memory of his former journey in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Mines, and considering anxiously the next course that he should take; a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">false turn now might be disastrous. After an hour he rose up and came over<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to Pippin.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Get into a corner and have a sleep, my lad,' he said in a kindly tone.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'You want to sleep, I expect. I cannot get a wink, so I may as well do the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">watching.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I know what is the matter with me,' he muttered, as he sat down by the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">door. 'I need smoke ! I have not tasted it since the morning before the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">snowstorm.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The last thing that Pippin saw, as sleep took him, was a dark glimpse<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of the old wizard huddled on the floor, shielding a glowing chip in his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gnarled hands between his knees. The flicker for a moment showed his sharp<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">nose, and the puff of smoke.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">It was Gandalf who roused them all from sleep. He had sat and watched<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">all alone for about six hours, and had let the others rest. 'And in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">watches I have made up my mind,' he said. 'I do not like the feel of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">middle way; and I do not like the smell of the left-hand way: there is foul<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">air down there, or I am no guide. I shall take the right-hand passage. It is<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time we began to climb up again.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">For eight dark hours, not counting two brief halts, they marched on;<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and they met no danger, and heard nothing, and saw nothing but the faint<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gleam of the wizard's light, bobbing like a will-o'-the-wisp in front of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">them. The passage they had chosen wound steadily upwards. As far as they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">could judge it went in great mounting curves, and as it rose it grew loftier<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and wider. There were now no openings to other galleries or tunnels on<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">either side, and the floor was level and sound, without pits or cracks.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Evidently they had struck what once had been an important road; and they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">went forward quicker than they had done on their first march.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">In this way they advanced some fifteen miles, measured in a direct line<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">east, though they must have actually walked twenty miles or more. As the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">road climbed upwards' Frodo's spirits rose a little; but he still felt<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">oppressed, and still at times he heard, or thought he heard, away behind the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Company and beyond the fall and patter of their feet, a following footstep<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that was not an echo.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They had marched as far as the hobbits could endure without a rest, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">all were thinking of a place where they could sleep, when suddenly the walls<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to right and left vanished. They seemed to have passed through some arched<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">doorway into a black and empty space. There was a great draught of warmer<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">air behind them, and before them the darkness was cold on their faces. They<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">halted and crowded anxiously together.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf seemed pleased. 'I chose the right way,' he said. 'At last we<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">are coming to the habitable parts, and I guess that we are not far now from<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the eastern side. But we are high up, a good deal higher than the Dimrill<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gate, unless I am mistaken. From the feeling of the air we must be in a wide<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hall. I will now risk a little real light.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He raised his staff, and for a brief instant there was blaze like a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flash of lightning. Great shadows sprang up and fled, and for a second they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">saw a vast roof far above their heads upheld by many mighty pillars hewn of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stone. Before them and on either side stretched a huge empty hall; its black<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">walls, polished and smooth as glass, flashed and glittered. Three other<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">entrances they saw, dark black arches: one straight before them eastwards,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and one on either side. Then the light went out.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'That is all that I shall venture on for the present,' said Gandalf.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There used to be great windows on the mountain-side, and shafts leading out<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the light in the upper reaches of the Mines. I think we have reached them<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">now, but it is night outside again, and we cannot tell until morning. If I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">am right, tomorrow we may actually see the morning peeping in. But in the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">meanwhile we had better go no further. Let us rest, if we can. Things have<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gone well so far, and the greater part of the dark road is over. But we are<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">not through yet, and it is a long way down to the Gates that open on the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">world.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Company spent that night in the great cavernous hall, huddled close<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">together in a corner to escape the draught: there seemed to be a steady<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">inflow of chill air through the eastern archway. All about them as they lay<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hung the darkness, hollow and immense, and they were oppressed by the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">loneliness and vastness of the dolven halls and endlessly branching stairs<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and passages. The wildest imaginings that dark rumour had ever suggested to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the hobbits fell altogether short of the actual dread and wonder of Moria.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There must have been a mighty crowd of dwarves here at one time ' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">make all this, and most in hard rock too! What did they do it all for? They<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'These are not holes,â€™ said Gimli. 'This is the great realm and city of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">He rose and standing in the dark he began to chant in a deep voice,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The world was young, the mountains green,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™For mithrif answered Gandalf. 'The wealth of Moria was not in gold<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">' Mithril! All folk desired it. It could be beaten like copper, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Frodo said nothing, but he put his hand under his tunic and touched the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Following his lead the Company passed under the northern arch. They<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">found themselves in a wide corridor. As they went along it the glimmer grew<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stronger, and they saw that it came through a doorway on their right. It was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">high and flat-topped, and the stone door was still upon its hinges, standing<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">half open. Beyond it was a large square chamber. It was dimly lit, but to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">their eyes, after so long a time in the dark, it seemed dazzlingly bright,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and they blinked as they entered.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Their feet disturbed a deep dust upon the floor, and stumbled among<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">things lying in the doorway whose shapes they could not at first make out.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The chamber was lit by a wide shaft high in the further eastern wall; it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">slanted upwards and, far above, a small square patch of blue sky could be<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seen. The light of the shaft fell directly on a table in the middle of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">room: a single oblong block, about two feet high, upon which was laid a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">great slab of white stone.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It looks like a tomb,â€™ muttered Frodo, and bent forwards with a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">curious sense of foreboding, to look more closely at it. Gandalf came<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">quickly to his side. On the slab runes were deeply graven:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">These are Daeron's Runes, such as were used of old in Moria,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf. 'Here is written in the tongues of Men and Dwarves:<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">balin son of fundin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lord of moria.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'He is dead then,' said Frodo. T feared it was so.' Gimli cast his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hood over his face.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Chapter 5 . The Bridge of Khazad-dym<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The Company of the Ring stood silent beside the tomb of Balin. Frodo<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thought of Bilbo and his long friendship with the dwarf, and of Balin's<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">visit to the Shire long ago. In that dusty chamber in the mountains it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">seemed a thousand years ago and on the other side of the world.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At length they stirred and looked up, and began to search for anything<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">that would give them tidings of Balin's fate, or show what had become of his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">folk. There was another smaller door on the other side of the chamber, under<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the shaft. By both the doors they could now see that many bones were lying,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and among them were broken swords and axe-heads, and cloven shields and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">helms. Some of the swords were crooked: ore-scimitars with blackened blades.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There were many recesses cut in the rock of the walls, and in them were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">large iron-bound chests of wood. All had been broken and plundered; but<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">beside the shattered lid of one there lay the remains of a book. It had been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">slashed and stabbed and partly burned, and it was so stained with black and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">other dark marks like old blood that little of it could be read. Gandalf<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">lifted it carefully, but the leaves crackled and broke as he laid it on the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">slab. He pored over it for some time without speaking. Frodo and Gimli<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">standing at his side could see, as he gingerly turned the leaves, that they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">were written by many different hands, in runes, both of Moria and of Dale,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and here and there in Elvish script.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At last Gandalf looked up. 'It seems to be a record of the fortunes of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Balin's folk,' he said. V I guess that it began with their coming to Dimrill<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Dale nigh on thirty years ago: the pages seem to have numbers referring to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the years after their arrival. The top page is marked one â€” three, so at<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">least two are missing from the beginning. Listen to this!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'We drove out ores from the great gate and guard â€” I think; the next<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">word is blurred and burned; probably room â€” we slew many in the bright â€” I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">think â€” sun in the dale. Flui was killed by an arrow. He slew the great.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then there is a blur followed by Flui under grass near Mirror mere. The next<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">line or two I cannot read. Then comes We have taken the twentyfirst hall of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">North end to dwell in. There is I cannot read what. A shaft is mentioned.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Then Balin has set up his seat in the Chamber of Mazarbul.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The Chamber of Records,' said Gimli. V I guess that is where we now<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">stand.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, I can read no more for a long way,' said Gandalf, â€™except the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">word gold , and Darin 's Axe and something helm. Then Balin is now lord of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Morici. That seems to end a chapter. After some stars another hand begins,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and I can see we found truesilver, and later the word wellforged and then<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">something, I have it! mithril; and the last two lines Uin to seek for the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">upper armouries of Third Deep, something go westwards, a blur, to Hollin<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">gate'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf paused and set a few leaves aside. 'There are several pages of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the same sort, rather hastily written and much damaged, he said; 'but I can<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">make little of them in this light. Now there must be a number of leaves<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">missing, because they begin to be numbered five, the fifth year of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">colony, I suppose. Let me see! No, they are too cut and stained; I cannot<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">read them. We might do better in the sunlight. Wait! Here is something: a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">large bold hand using an Elvish script.â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™That would be Ori's hand,' said Gimli, looking over the wizard's arm.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'He could write well and speedily, and often used the Elvish characters.â€™<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'I fear he had ill tidings to record in a fair hand,' said Gandalf.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'The first clear word is sorrow, but the rest of the line is lost, unless it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ends in estre. Yes, it must be yestre followed by day being the tenth of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">novembre Balin lord of Moria fell in Dimrill Dale. He went alone to look in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Mirror mere, an ore shot him from behind a stone, we slew the ore, hut many<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">more ...up from east up the Silverlode. The remainder of the page is so<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and suffer. Poor Balin! He seems to have kept the title that he took for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'It is grim reading,' he said. 'I fear their end was cruel. Listen! We<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cannot get out. We cannot get out. They have taken the Bridge and second<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hall. Frbr and Luni and Nbli fell there. Then there are four lines smeared<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">so that I can only read went 5 days ago. The last lines run the pool is up<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to the wall at Westgate. The Watcher in the Water took Uin. We cannot get<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">out. The end comes, and then drums, drums in the deep. I wonder what that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">means. The last thing written is in a trailing scrawl of elf-letters: they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">are coming. There is nothing more.' Gandalf paused and stood in silent<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">thought.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">A sudden dread and a horror of the chamber fell on the Company. ' We<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cannot get out,' muttered Gimli. 'It was well for us that the pool had sunk<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a little, and that the Watcher was sleeping down at the southern end.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf raised his head and looked round. 'They seem to have made a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">last stand by both doors,' he said; 'but there were not many left by that<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time. So ended the attempt to retake Moria! It was valiant but foolish. The<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">time is not come yet. Now, I fear, we must say farewell to Balin son of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Fundin. Here he must lie in the halls of his fathers. We will take this<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">book, the Book of Mazarbul, and look at it more closely later. You had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">better keep it, Gimli, and take it back to Dbin, if you get a chance. It<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Which way shall we go? ' asked Boromir.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Therefore we should leave by the eastern arch of the hall, and bear right<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and south, and go downwards. The Twenty-first Hall should be on the Seventh<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Level, that is six above the level of the Gates. Come now! Back to the hall!<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">f<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Gandalf had hardly spoken these words, when there came a great noise: a<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Wait a moment! Do not close it yet! ' said Gandalf. He sprang forward<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to Boromir's side and drew himself up to his full height.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Who comes hither to disturb the rest of Balin Lord of Moria? ' he<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">cried in a loud voice.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was a rush of hoarse laughter, like the fall of sliding stones<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">into a pit; amid the clamour a deep voice was raised in command. Doom,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">boom,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">doom went the drums in the deep.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">With a quick movement Gandalf stepped before the narrow opening of the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">door and thrust forward his staff: There was a dazzling flash that lit the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">chamber and the passage outside. For an instant the wizard looked out.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Arrows whined and whistled down the corridor as he sprang back.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There are Ores, very many of them,' he said. 'And some are large and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">evil: black Uruks of Mordor. For the moment they are hanging back, but there<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">is something else there. A great cave-troll, I think, or more than one.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There is no hope of escape that way.'<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'And no hope at all, if they come at the other door as well,' said<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Boromir.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'There is no sound outside here yet,' said Aragorn, who was standing by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">a stair: it plainly does not lead back towards the hall. But it is no good<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">flying blindly this way with the pursuit just behind. We cannot block the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">door. Its key is gone and the lock is broken, and it opens inwards. We must<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">do something to delay the enemy first. We will make them fear the Chamber of<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Mazarbul!â€™ he said grimly feeling the edge of his sword, AndÂ®ril.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Heavy feet were heard in the corridor. Boromir flung himself against<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the door and heaved it to; then he wedged it with broken sword-blades and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">But they had no chance to fly yet. There was a blow on the door that made it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">quiver; and then it began to grind slowly open, driving back the wedges. A<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Boromir leaped forward and hewed at the arm with all his might; but his<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Suddenly, and to his own surprise, Frodo felt a hot wrath blaze up in<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and stabbed with Sting at the hideous foot. There was a bellow, and the foot<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">jerked back, nearly wrenching Sting from Frodo's arm. Black drops dripped<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'One for the Shire! ' cried Aragorn. 'The hobbit's bite is deep! You<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have a good blade, Frodo son of Drogo ! '<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">There was a crash on the door, followed by crash after crash. Rams and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">hammers were beating against it. It cracked and staggered back, and the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">How many there were the Company could not count. The affray was sharp,<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">but the ores were dismayed by the fierceness of the defence. Legolas shot<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">two through the throat. Gimli hewed the legs from under another that had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">sprung up on Balin' s tomb. Boromir and Aragorn slew many. When thirteen<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">fallen the rest fled shrieking, leaving the defenders unharmed, except for<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">had felled his ore: a sturdy thrust with his Barrow-blade. A fire was<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">smouldering in his brown eyes that would have made Ted Sandyman step<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Now is the time! ' cried Gandalf. 'Let us go, before the troll<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">But even as they retreated, and before Pippin and Merry had reached the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Doom, doom went the drums in the deep. The great voice rolled out<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

</span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Aragorn picked up Frodo where he lay by the wall and made for the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Do as I say! ' said Gandalf fiercely. 'Swords are no more use here.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">The passage was lit by no shaft and was utterly dark. They groped their<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">way down a long flight of steps, and then looked back; but they could see<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">Suddenly at the top of the stair there was a stab of white light. Then<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">doom-boom, doom-boom, and then stopped. Gandalf came flying down the<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">steps<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">and fell to the ground in the midst of the Company.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'Well, well! That's over! ' said the wizard struggling to his feet. 'I<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">have done all that I could. But I have met my match, and have nearly been<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">They stumbled after him wondering what had happened. Doom, doom<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">the drum-beats again: they now sounded muffled and far away, but they were<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">following. There was no other sound of pursuit, neither tramp of feet, nor<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">any voice. Gandalf took no turns, right or left, for the passage seemed to<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">be going in the direction that he desired. Every now and again it descended<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">their chief danger; for in the dark they could not see a descent, until they<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>
</span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">At the end of an hour they had gone a mile, or maybe a little more, and<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">â€™I do not know,' answered Gandalf. 'But I found myself suddenly faced<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">to try and put a shutting -spell on the door. I know many; but to do things<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">of that kind rightly requires time, and even then the door can be broken by<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3">strength.<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
<p class="p4"><span class="s3"><br>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">'As I stood there I could hear ore- voices on the other side: at any<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>

<p class="p4"><span class="s3">ghvsh; that is "fire". Then something came into the chamber â€” I felt it<span class="Apple-converted-space"> </span></span></p>
